content.question: A launcher with mass <math alttext="m sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math> is compressed by a block with mass <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub L is greater than m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. The launcher is on a horizontal surface with negligible friction. Just after the block exits the launcher, the launcher and block have speeds <math alttext="v sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, respectively, as shown in the figure. Which of the following is a true statement about the forces exerted between the launcher and the block?

choices.label: The launcher exerts a greater force on the block than the block exerts on the launcher.
The block exerts a greater force on the launcher than the launcher exerts on the block.
The block and the launcher exert forces of equal magnitude on each other.

The relative magnitude of the force exerted on the spring by the block and launcher cannot be determined without knowing <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math>.

content.answer: The block and the launcher exert forces of equal magnitude on each other.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
